genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:name: ANGUILLA
genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:gencAdditionalInfo: Anguilla is a British Overseas Territory. British Overseas Territories are distinct areas that are not part of the territory of the United Kingdom. There are 14 such territories, including: Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territory; British Virgin Islands; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Islands; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia); and the Turks and Caicos Islands. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) ISO 3166-1 contains entries for twelve of the fourteen British Overseas Territories. The two British Overseas Territories omitted from ISO 3166-1 are the British Antarctic Territory (ISO includes no national Antarctic claims) and the Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia, as a single B.O.T.). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for any of those territories as an administrative subdivision of the United Kingdom. GENC also contains specific top-level entries for the same twelve British Overseas Territories found in ISO 3166-1, and in addition, GENC contains separate entries for each of Akrotiri, Dhekelia, and Diego Garcia.

genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:name: BOUVET ISLAND
genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:gencAdditionalInfo: Bouvet Island is under Norwegian sovereignty, but it is not a part of the geospatial extent of Norway. The English-language site of Statistics Norway ([http://www.ssb.no/english/subjects/00/minifakta_en/en/]) gives the dimensions of Norway in coordinates, all of which are in the Northern Hemisphere; also, it lists the total area (in square kilometers) of the Kingdom of Norway as including the areas of Svalbard and Jan Mayen, with a separate listing for the Antarctic Territories (including Bouvet Island); the Antarctic area is not added into the total for the Kingdom of Norway. Note that both the top-level GENC and ISO 3166-1 contain entries for Bouvet Island. Also note that there is no administrative subdivision for Norway under the entry "NORWAY" in ISO 3166-2.

genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:name: DENMARK

Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166/MA consider Denmark as excluding the geospatial extent of the Faroe Islands and Greenland. The latter have their own separate entries in the GENC Standard, as well as in ISO 3166-1, and they are not listed in ISO 3166-2 as administrative subdivisions of the entry named "DENMARK" (see ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:name: UNITED KINGDOM
genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:fullName: the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:gencAdditionalInfo: In the Short Name, Full Name, and at least one Local Short Name a preceding definite article "the" appears that should not be used in the context of the GENC Standard. Based on research into the British Overseas Territories (which include: Akrotiri and Dhekelia; Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territories; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Island; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Turks and Caicos Islands and the Virgin Islands, British), those territories are considered external to the territory of the United Kingdom. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) And ISO 3166-1 represents 12 of the 14 territories with specific entries; it does not include an entry for the British Antarctic Territory, or for the Sovereign Base Area of Akrotiri and Dhekelia. Thus either those U.K. Sovereign Base Areas are unrepresented in ISO 3166-1, or they are represented under the entry named "UNITED KINGDOM". Even if the Sovereign Base Areas were covered using the code elements for the U.K., it is not clear whether ISO 3166-1 would be making the assertion that their territory is part of the U.K. (esecially when the U.K. does not make that assertion).

genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:name: UZBEKISTAN
genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:gencAdditionalInfo: In the Full Name a preceding definite article "the" appears that should not be used in the context of the GENC Standard.

genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:name: ZAMBIA
genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:gencAdditionalInfo: In the Full Name a preceding definite article "the" appears that should not be used in the context of the GENC Standard.

genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:name: ZIMBABWE
genc:ISOCountryEntry.genc:gencAdditionalInfo: In the Full Name a preceding definite article "the" appears that should not be used in the context of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: AFGHANISTAN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Islamic Republic of Afghanistan" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fa'/'fas' as "Afghānistān" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Afghānestān".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: AKROTIRI
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: U.K. Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Akrotiri.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Akrotiri is part of a British Overseas Territory and under British sovereignty. It is not clear whether ISO 3166/MA considers the code elements for the entry named "UNITED KINGDOM" as covering the territories of Akrotiri and Dhekelia; however, neither Akrotiri nor Dhekelia appears in the ISO 3166-2 administrative subdivisions of the United Kingdom, so the presumption is that their territory is not included under that entry (see ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)). The two Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia together constitute the British Overseas Territory on Cyprus that was ceded to the United Kingdom in the 1960 Treaty of Establishment, in which the U.K. granted independence to the Crown Colony of Cyprus; the U.K., Cyprus, and Turkey were all signatories to that treaty. Note that British Overseas Territories are not considered part of the territory of the United Kingdom (see [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) Apart from the Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus, all of the other British Overseas Territories have their own separate entries in ISO 3166-1 (and in the GENC as well).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ALBANIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Albania" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Albania". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'sq'/'sqi' as "Shqipëria" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Shqipëria, Shqipëri".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: AMERICAN SAMOA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Principal island: Tutuila; Includes Swains Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Territory of American Samoa" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "American Samoa". Additionally, in order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Principal island: Tutuila; Includes Swains Island." while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Principal island: Tutuila; Includes Swain's Island."
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geographic territory of American Samoa to be specifically excluded from the geographic territory of the entry named "UNITED STATES". Note that the ISO 3166/MA considers the United States as including the geographic territory of American Samoa; while ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "AMERICAN SAMOA", ISO 3166-2 specifies a code element for American Samoa as a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ANTIGUA AND BARBUDA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Redonda
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Redonda", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Redonda Island".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ARUBA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Aruba from the entry named "NETHERLANDS". Note that, although ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "ARUBA", ISO 3166-2 correspondingly specifies a code element for Aruba as an administrative subdivision (of type "country") of the entry named "NETHERLANDS" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)). In the GENC Standard, the territory of Aruba is represented exclusively by the entry named "ARUBA". Note: There may be ambiguity in the standards between the country of the Netherlands and the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ASHMORE AND CARTIER ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Territory of Ashmore and Cartier Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the Ashmore and Cartier Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-1 considers the entry named "AUSTRALIA" as including the geographic territory of the Ashmore and Cartier Islands.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: AUSTRALIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Lord Howe Island and Macquarie Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Commonwealth of Australia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Australia".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the entry named "AUSTRALIA" to specifically exclude the geospatial extent of the Ashmore and Cartier Islands, Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, the Coral Sea Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island; each of those territories has a distinct entry in the GENC Standard. Note that ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "AUSTRALIA" as specifically including the geographic territory of the Ashmore and Cartier Islands, and the Coral Sea Islands (see the ISO 3166-1 Remarks). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not include any external territories as administrative subdivisions under the entry named "AUSTRALIA". (See ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision).)

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BAHAMAS, THE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "BAHAMAS, THE" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "BAHAMAS"; GENC specifies the short name "Bahamas, The" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bahamas (The)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Commonwealth of The Bahamas" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Commonwealth of The Bahamas". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Bahamas, The" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bahamas (The)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BAKER ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Baker Island. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Baker Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Baker Island as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BANGLADESH
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "People's Republic of Bangladesh" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the People's Republic of Bangladesh". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'bn'/'ben' as "Bangladesh" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bāṁlādesh".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BASSAS DA INDIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Bassas da India.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the GENC entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of Bassas da India (one of the French scattered Indian Ocean islands). Note that ISO 3166-1 states that Bassas da India is included in the entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN TERRITORIES".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BELARUS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Belarus" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Belarus". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'be'/'bel' as "Byelarus’" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bielarus'".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BOLIVIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "BOLIVIA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "BOLIVIA, PLURINATIONAL STATE OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Bolivia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bolivia, Plurinational State of"; and GENC specifies the full name "Plurinational State of Bolivia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Plurinational State of Bolivia".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BONAIRE, SINT EUSTATIUS, AND SABA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard differs ISO 3166-1 in the punctuation of the name; GENC uses a comma before the "and" in all forms of the name, whereas ISO 3166-1 does not. In particular, the GENC Standard specifies the name "BONAIRE, SINT EUSTATIUS, AND SABA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "BONAIRE, SINT EUSTATIUS AND SABA"; GENC specifies the short name "Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba"; and GENC specifies the full name "Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba". Additionally, the GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba from the entry named "NETHERLANDS". Note that, although ISO 3166-1 includes a collective entry named "BONAIRE, SINT EUSTATIUS AND SABA", ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba individually as administrative subdivisions (of type "special municipalities") of both the entry "BONAIRE, SINT EUSTATIUS AND SABA", and of the entry named "NETHERLANDS" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)). In the GENC Standard, the territory of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba is represented exclusively by the entry named "BONAIRE, SINT EUSTATIUS, AND SABA". Note: There appears to be an ambiguity in ISO 3166 between "NETHERLANDS" as representing the country of the Netherlands or the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BRAZIL
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Atol das Rocas, Arquipélago de Fernando de Noronha, Ilha da Trindade, Ilhas Martin Vaz, and Penedos de São Pedro e São Paulo
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Federative Republic of Brazil" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Federative Republic of Brazil". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies (and identify included areas with greater specificity) the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Atol das Rocas, Arquipélago de Fernando de Noronha, Ilha da Trindade, Ilhas Martin Vaz, and Penedos de São Pedro e São Paulo", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Fernando de Noronha Island, Martim Vaz Islands, Trindade Island". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'pt'/'por' as "Brasil", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Brasil (o)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BRITISH INDIAN OCEAN TERRITORY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "British Indian Ocean Territory" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "British Indian Ocean Territory (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "British Indian Ocean Territory" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "British Indian Ocean Territory (the)". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "British Indian Ocean Territory" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "British Indian Ocean Territory (the)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the entry named "BRITISH INDIAN OCEAN TERRITORY" to specifically exclude the geospatial extent of the atoll Diego Garcia, because the GENC Standard includes a distinct top-level entry for "DIEGO GARCIA". ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "BRITISH INDIAN OCEAN TERRITORY" to include Diego Garcia, as stated in ISO 3166-1. British Indian Ocean Territory is a British Overseas Territory. British Overseas Territories are distinct areas that are not part of the territory of the United Kingdom. There are 14 such territories, including: Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territory; British Virgin Islands; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Islands; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia); and the Turks and Caicos Islands. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) ISO 3166-1 contains entries for twelve of the fourteen British Overseas Territories. The two British Overseas Territories omitted from ISO 3166-1 are the British Antarctic Territory (ISO includes no national Antarctic claims) and the Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia, as a single British Overseas Territory). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for any of those territories as an administrative subdivision of the United Kingdom. GENC also contains specific top-level entries for the same twelve British Overseas Territories found in ISO 3166-1, and in addition, GENC contains separate entries for each of Akrotiri, Dhekelia, and Diego Garcia.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BRUNEI
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "BRUNEI" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "BRUNEI DARUSSALAM"; and GENC specifies the short name "Brunei" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Brunei Darussalam". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Brunei" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Brunei Darussalam".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of the Spratly Islands from the entry named "BRUNEI"; those islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam, and in part by Brunei, Malaysia, and Philippines. The ISO 3166/MA may consider some or all of the territory of the Spratly Islands to be included under the ISO 3166-1 entry named "BRUNEI DARUSSALAM".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BULGARIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Bulgaria" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Bulgaria". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'bg'/'bul' as "Bŭlgariya" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bălgarija (Bulgaria)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BURKINA FASO
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Burkina Faso" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Burkina (le)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: BURMA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "BURMA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "MYANMAR"; GENC specifies the short name "Burma" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Myanmar"; and GENC specifies the full name "Union of Burma" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of the Union of Myanmar". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'my'/'mya' as "Myanma Naingngandaw" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Myanma".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CAPE VERDE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Principal islands: Santiago, São Vicente
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Cape Verde" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Cape Verde". In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Principal islands: Santiago, São Vicente", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Principal islands: São Tiago, São Vicente".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CENTRAL AFRICAN REPUBLIC
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Central African Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Central African Republic (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Central African Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Central African Republic". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "République Centrafricaine" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "République centrafricaine (la)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CHILE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Easter Island, Archipiélago Juan Fernández, Isla Sala y Gómez, Isla San Ambrosio, Isla San Félix
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Chile" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Chile". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Easter Island, Archipiélago Juan Fernández, Isla Sala y Gómez, Isla San Ambrosio, Isla San Félix", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Easter Island, Juan Fernández Islands, Sala y Gómez Island, San Ambrosio Island, San Félix Island".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CHINA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "People’s Republic of China" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the People's Republic of China". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'zh'/'zho' as "Zhonghua Renmin Gongheguo" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Zhongguo".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the entry named "CHINA" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan, each of which has a distinct entry in the GENC Standard. The ISO 3166/MA considers their geography territory to be included under the ISO 3166-1 entry named "CHINA"; while ISO 3166-1 includes entries named "HONG KONG", "MACAO", and "TAIWAN, PROVINCE OF CHINA", they are also included in ISO 3166-2 as administrative subdivisions of China, with the names "Hong Kong" and "Macao" (both of type: special administrative region) and "Taiwan" (type: province). In the GENC Standard, those three territories are represented exclusively by the entries named "HONG KONG", "MACAU" and "TAIWAN". The GENC Standard also specifically excludes the geospatial extent of the Paracel Islands from coverage under the entry named "CHINA"; those islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam. The GENC Standard represents them with a separate entry named "PARACEL ISLANDS". The GENC Standard also specifically excludes the Spratly Islands from coverage under the entry named "CHINA"; those islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam, and in part by Brunei, Malaysia, and Philippines. The GENC Standard represents them with a separate entry named "SPRATLY ISLANDS". The ISO 3166/MA may consider some or all of the territory of the Paracel Islands or Spratly Islands to be included under the ISO 3166-1 entry named "CHINA" (for example, the standard is not detailed enough to tell whether the administrative subdivision named "Hainan" (code element: CN-46) includes the Paracel Islands).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CHRISTMAS ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Territory of Christmas Island" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Christmas Island".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166/MA consider the geospatial extent of Christmas Island as external to the territory of Australia. The GENC Standard contains separate top-level entries for the external territories of Australia (including the Ashmore and Cartier Islands, Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, the Coral Sea Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island); as a general principle, top-level GENC entries do not overlap in territory. The Australian external territories that have entries in ISO 3166-1 (Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island) do not have corresponding entries as administrative subdivisions in ISO 3166-2, thus are not included in the geospatial extent of Australia (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CLIPPERTON ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO exceptionally-reserved code elements for Clipperton Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes Clipperton Island, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for an administrative subdivision (of type "dependency") named "Clipperton".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: COCOS (KEELING) ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Cocos (Keeling) Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Cocos (Keeling) Islands (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Territory of Cocos (Keeling) Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Cocos (Keeling) Islands (the)". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Cocos (Keeling) Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Cocos Islands/Keeling Islands (the)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166/MA consider the geospatial extent of the Cocos (Keeling) Islands as external to the territory of Australia. The GENC Standard contains separate top-level entries for the external territories of Australia (including the Ashmore and Cartier Islands, Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, the Coral Sea Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island); as a general principle, top-level GENC entries do not overlap in territory. The Australian external territories that have entries in ISO 3166-1 (Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island) do not have corresponding entries as administrative subdivisions in ISO 3166-2, thus are not included in the geospatial extent of Australia (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: COLOMBIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Isla de Malpelo and Archipiélago de San Andrés y Providencia
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Colombia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Colombia". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Isla de Malpelo and Archipiélago de San Andrés y Providencia", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Malpelo Island, San Andrés y Providencia Islands".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: COMOROS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises Anjouan, Grande Comore, Mohéli
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Union of the Comoros" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Union of the Comoros". GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ar'/'ara' as "Juzur al Qamar" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Al Qamar"; it also specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Comores", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comores (les)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CONGO (BRAZZAVILLE)
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "CONGO (BRAZZAVILLE)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "CONGO"; GENC specifies the short name "Congo (Brazzaville)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Congo"; and GENC specifies the full name "Republic of the Congo" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies ""the Republic of the Congo". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Congo", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Congo (le)". Note, however, that the parenthesis is not part of the official name, but instead indicates the capital of the country for purposes of differentiating two countries with the same name.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CONGO (KINSHASA)
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "CONGO (KINSHASA)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "CONGO, THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE"; GENC specifies the short name "Congo (Kinshasa)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Congo (the Democratic Republic of the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Democratic Republic of the Congo" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Democratic Republic of the Congo". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Congo" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Congo (la République démocratique du)". Note, however, that the parenthesis is not part of the official name, but instead indicates the capital of the country for purposes of differentiating two countries with the same name.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CORAL SEA ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the Coral Sea Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-1 considers the entry named "AUSTRALIA" as including the geographic territory of the Coral Sea Islands.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: COSTA RICA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Isla de Coco
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Costa Rica" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Costa Rica". In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Isla de Coco", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Coco Island".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CUBA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the entry named "CUBA" to specifically exclude the geospatial extent of the leased area at Guantanamo Bay housing the U.S. Naval Base, because the GENC Standard includes a distinct top-level entry for "GUANTANAMO BAY". It is not clear whether ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "CUBA" as specifically including that leased area; however, there is no separate entry for that leased area of Cuba in either ISO 3166-1 or ISO 3166-2.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CURAÇAO
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Curaçao from the entry named "NETHERLANDS". Note that, although ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "CURAÇAO", ISO 3166-2 correspondingly specifies a code element for Curaçao as an administrative subdivision (of type "country") of the entry named "NETHERLANDS" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)). In the GENC Standard, the territory of Curaçao is represented exclusively by the entry named "CURAÇAO". Note: There may be ambiguity in the standards between the country of the Netherlands and the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CYPRUS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Cyprus" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Cyprus".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geopolitical entity named "CYPRUS" to specifically exclude the geospatial extent of both Akrotiri and Dhekelia, which are represented by distinct top-level entries in GENC. There is no entry for Akrotiri or Dhekelia in ISO 3166-1 or ISO 3166-2. It is not clear whether ISO 3166/MA considers the code elements for the entry named "UNITED KINGDOM" as covering the territories of Akrotiri and Dhekelia; however, neither Akrotiri nor Dhekelia appears in the ISO 3166-2 administrative subdivisions of the United Kingdom, so the presumption is that their territory is not included under that entry (see ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)). The two Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia together constitute the British Overseas Territory on Cyprus that was ceded to the United Kingdom in the 1960 Treaty of Establishment, in which the U.K. granted independence to the Crown Colony of Cyprus; the U.K., Cyprus, and Turkey were all signatories to that treaty. Note that British Overseas Territories are not considered part of the territory of the United Kingdom (see [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) Apart from the Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus, all of the other British Overseas Territories have their own separate entries in ISO 3166-1 (and in the GENC as well).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: CZECH REPUBLIC
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Czech Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Czech Republic (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Czech Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Czech Republic". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'cs'/'ces' as "Česká Republika" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Česko".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: DHEKELIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: U.K. Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Dhekelia.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Dhekelia is part of a British Overseas Territory and under British sovereignty. It is not clear whether ISO 3166/MA considers the code elements for the entry named "UNITED KINGDOM" as covering the territories of Akrotiri and Dhekelia; however, neither Akrotiri nor Dhekelia appears in the ISO 3166-2 administrative subdivisions of the United Kingdom, so the presumption is that their territory is not included under that entry (see ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)). The two Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia together constitute the British Overseas Territory on Cyprus that was ceded to the United Kingdom in the 1960 Treaty of Establishment, in which the U.K. granted independence to the Crown Colony of Cyprus; the U.K., Cyprus, and Turkey were all signatories to that treaty. Note that British Overseas Territories are not considered part of the territory of the United Kingdom (see [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) Apart from the Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus, all of the other British Overseas Territories have their own separate entries in ISO 3166-1 (and in the GENC as well).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: DIEGO GARCIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: The largest and only inhabited island in the British Indian Ocean Territory.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO exceptionally-reserved code elements for Diego Garcia.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ECUADOR
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Galapagos Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Ecuador" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Ecuador". In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Galapagos Islands", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Galápagos Islands". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'es'/'esp' as "Ecuador", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Ecuador (el)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ENTITY 1
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: A geopolitical entity that is able to be identified; however, the content of its specification cannot be communicated in an unclassified information processing environment.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes this 3-character ISO user-assigned code element.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ENTITY 2
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: A geopolitical entity that is able to be identified; however, the content of its specification cannot be communicated in an unclassified information processing environment.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes this 3-character ISO user-assigned code element.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ENTITY 3
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: A geopolitical entity that is able to be identified; however, the content of its specification cannot be communicated in an unclassified information processing environment.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes this 3-character ISO user-assigned code element.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ENTITY 4
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: A geopolitical entity that is able to be identified; however, the content of its specification cannot be communicated in an unclassified information processing environment.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes this 3-character ISO user-assigned code element.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ENTITY 5
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: A geopolitical entity that is able to be identified; however, the content of its specification cannot be communicated in an unclassified information processing environment.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes this 3-character ISO user-assigned code element.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: EQUATORIAL GUINEA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises Rio Muni, the islands of Annobón, Bioko, and Corisco, and Islas de Elobey
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Equatorial Guinea" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Equatorial Guinea". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies (and identify additional included areas) the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Comprises Rio Muni, the islands of Annobón, Bioko, and Corisco, and Islas de Elobey ", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comprises Annobón Island, Bioko Island, the Continental Region (Rio Muni)". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Guinée équatoriale", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Guinée équatoriale (la)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ETOROFU, HABOMAI, KUNASHIRI, AND SHIKOTAN ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:shortName: Etorofu, Habomai, Kunashiri, and Shikotan Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Etorofu, Habomai, Kunashiri, and Shikotan Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the Etorofu, Habomai, Kunashiri, and Shikotan Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-1 may consider the entry named "RUSSIAN FEDERATION" as including the geographic territory of the Etorofu, Habomai, Kunashiri, and Shikotan Islands (southernmost members of the Kuril Islands) as a component of its ISO 3166-2 Sakhalin Oblast administrative subdivision (which is of type "administrative region"). Occupied by the Soviet Union in 1945, the Etorofu, Habomai, Kunashiri, and Shikotan Islands are currently administered by Russia while being claimed by Japan.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: EUROPA ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Europa Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the GENC entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of Europa Island (one of the French scattered Indian Ocean islands). Note that ISO 3166-1 states that Europa Island is included in the entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN TERRITORIES".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: FALKLAND ISLANDS (ISLAS MALVINAS)
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "FALKLAND ISLANDS (ISLAS MALVINAS)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "FALKLAND ISLANDS (MALVINAS)"; GENC specifies the short name "Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Falkland Islands (the) [Malvinas]"; and GENC specifies the full name "Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Falkland Islands (the) [Malvinas]". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas)" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Falkland Islands (the) [Malvinas]".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Falkland Islands is a British Overseas Territory. British Overseas Territories are distinct areas that are not part of the territory of the United Kingdom. There are 14 such territories, including: Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territory; British Virgin Islands; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Islands; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia); and the Turks and Caicos Islands. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) ISO 3166-1 contains entries for twelve of the fourteen British Overseas Territories. The two British Overseas Territories omitted from ISO 3166-1 are the British Antarctic Territory (ISO includes no national Antarctic claims) and the Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia, as a single British Overseas Territory). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for any of those territories as an administrative subdivision of the United Kingdom. GENC also contains specific top-level entries for the same twelve British Overseas Territories found in ISO 3166-1, and in addition, GENC contains separate entries for each of Akrotiri, Dhekelia, and Diego Garcia.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: FRANCE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "French Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the French Republic". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "France", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "France (la)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geopolitical entity named "FRANCE" as excluding the geospatial extent of the dependency of Clipperton Island; the overseas departments of French Guiana, Guadeloupe, Martinique, Mayotte, and Reunion; the overseas territorial collectivities of French Polynesia, New Caledonia, Saint Barthelemy, Saint Martin, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, and Wallis and Futuna; and the overseas territory of the French Southern Lands, because each of those geographic territories is represented by a distinct entry in the GENC Standard. Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes all of those geographic territories, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for them as administrative subdivisions of France.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: FRENCH GUIANA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Department of Guiana" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "French Guiana". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Guyane", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Guyane (la)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of French Guiana from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes French Guiana, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas department") named "Guyane (française)" (local name).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: FRENCH POLYNESIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises Îles Tubuaï, Îles Gambier, Îles Marquises, Society Islands (principal island: Tahiti), and Archipel des Tuamotu.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of French Polynesia from the entry named "FRANCE". Additionally, in order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Comprises Îles Tubuaï, Îles Gambier, Îles Marquises, Society Islands (principal island: Tahiti), and Archipel des Tuamotu.", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comprises Austral Islands, Gambier Islands, Marquesas Islands, Society Archipelago (principal island: Tahiti), and the Tuamotu Islands." The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Polynésie Française" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Polynésie française (la)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes French Polynesia, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas territorial collectivity") named "Polynésie française" (local name).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises Île Amsterdam, Îles Crozet, Îles Kerguelen, and Île Saint-Paul
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "FRENCH SOUTHERN TERRITORIES"; GENC specifies the short name "French Southern and Antarctic Lands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "French Southern Territories (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "French Southern and Antarctic Lands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "French Southern Territories (the)". Additionally, in order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Comprises Île Amsterdam, Îles Crozet, Îles Kerguelen, and Île Saint-Paul", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comprises Amsterdam Island, Crozet Archipelago, Kerguelen Islands, Saint-Paul Island and and French scattered Indian Ocean Islands formed by Bassas da India, Europa Island, Glorioso Islands, Juan de Nova Island and Tromelin Island". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Terres Australes et Antarctiques Françaises" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Terres australes françaises (les)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geopolitical entity named "FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of Bassas da India, Europa Island, Glorioso Islands, Juan de Nova Island, and Tromelin Island, because each of those territories has a distinct entry in the GENC Standard. Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN LANDS" includes all of those territories (and also that French Southern Lands is itself included in the entry named "FRANCE"). Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166-1 exclude the geographic territory of the French-claimed portion of Antarctica (Terre Adelie), which instead is covered by the entry named "ANTARCTICA".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GAMBIA, THE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "GAMBIA, THE" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "GAMBIA"; GENC specifies the short name "Gambia, The" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Gambia (The)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Republic of The Gambia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of The Gambia". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Gambia, The" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Gambia (The)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GAZA STRIP
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the Gaza Strip. The status of the Gaza Strip is a final status issue to be resolved through negotiation.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The Gaza Strip is a geospatial component of the GENC entry named "PALESTINIAN TERRITORY".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GEORGIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ka'/'kat' as "Sakartvelo" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Sak'art'velo".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GLORIOSO ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the Glorioso Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the GENC entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of the Glorioso Islands (one of the French scattered Indian Ocean islands). Note that ISO 3166-1 considers the Glorioso Islands to be included in the entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN TERRITORIES".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GUADELOUPE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes la Désirade, Marie-Galante, and les Saintes.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Department of Guadeloupe" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Guadeloupe". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Guadeloupe", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Guadeloupe (la)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Guadeloupe from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes Guadeloupe, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas department") named "Guadeloupe".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GUAM
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Territory of Guam" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Guam".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geographic territory of Guam to be specifically excluded from the geographic territory of the entry named "UNITED STATES". Note that the ISO 3166/MA considers the United States as including the geographic territory of Guam; while ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "GUAM", ISO 3166-2 specifies a code element for Guam as a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GUANTANAMO BAY NAVAL BASE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: U.S. Naval Base Area on Cuba
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Guantanamo Bay Naval Base is a U.S. Naval Base Area operated under a perpetual lease granting "complete jurisdiction and control" of the area although the Republic of Cuba retains ultimate sovereignty. There is no entry for Guantanamo Bay Naval Base in ISO 3166-1 or ISO 3166-2. It is not clear whether ISO 3166/MA would consider the geographic territory of Guantanamo Bay Naval Base to be covered by the code elements for the ISO 3166-1 entry named "CUBA".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GUERNSEY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Bailiwick of Guernsey" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Guernsey".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Guernsey is part of the Channel Islands, which is a British Crown Dependency, and therefore not included in the territory of the United Kingdom (see the web site of the British Monarcy regarding the Channel Islands: [http://www.royal.gov.uk/MonarchUK/QueenandCrowndependencies/ChannelIslands.aspx].) Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166-1 represent Guernsey as a top-level entry. Also note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for Guernsey as an administrative subdivision of the entry named "UNITED KINGDOM".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: GUYANA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Co-operative Republic of Guyana" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Guyana".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: HEARD ISLAND AND MCDONALD ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Territory of Heard Island and McDonald Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Territory of Heard Island and McDonald Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Heard Island and McDonald Islands".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166/MA consider the geospatial extent of Heard Island and McDonald Islands as external to the territory of Australia. The GENC Standard contains separate top-level entries for the external territories of Australia (including the Ashmore and Cartier Islands, Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, the Coral Sea Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island); as a general principle, top-level GENC entries do not overlap in territory. The Australian external territories that have entries in ISO 3166-1 (Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island) do not have corresponding entries as administrative subdivisions in ISO 3166-2, thus are not included in the geospatial extent of Australia (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: HONG KONG
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Hong Kong Special Administrative Region" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of China".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geospatial extent of Hong Kong to be distinct from that covered by the entry named "CHINA"; it is represented exclusively by the GENC entry named "HONG KONG". Note that ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "CHINA" as including the geographic territory of Hong Kong; ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "HONG KONG", but also ISO 3166-2 specifies a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "special administrative region") named "Hong Kong".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: HOWLAND ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Howland Island. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Howland Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Howland Island as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: INDIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Andaman Islands, Lakshadweep, Nicobar Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of India" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of India". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Andaman Islands, Lakshadweep, Nicobar Islands", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Amindivi Islands, Andaman Islands, Laccadive Islands, Minicoy Island, Nicobar Islands".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: IRAN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "IRAN" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "IRAN, ISLAMIC REPUBLIC OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Iran" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Iran (the Islamic Republic of)"; and GENC specifies the long name "Islamic Republic of Iran" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Islamic Republic of Iran". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fa'/'fas' as "Īrān" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Jomhūrī-ye Eslāmī-ye Īrān".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: ITALY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Italian Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Italy". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'it'/'ita' as "Italia", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Italia (l')".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: JAN MAYEN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Jan Mayen (distinct from those for Svalbard). ISO 3166-1 includes a single composite entry named "SVALBARD AND JAN MAYEN".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: ISO 3166-1 covers this area under the entry named "SVALBARD AND JAN MAYEN". Note also that ISO 3166-2 considers the ISO 3166-1 entry named "NORWAY" as including the geographic territory of Jan Mayen as an administrative subdivision (of type "arctic region").

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: JARVIS ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Jarvis Island. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Jarvis Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Jarvis Island as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: JERSEY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Bailiwick of Jersey" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Jersey".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Jersey is part of the Channel Islands, which is a British Crown Dependency, and therefore not included in the territory of the United Kingdom (see the web site of the British Monarcy regarding the Channel Islands: [http://www.royal.gov.uk/MonarchUK/QueenandCrowndependencies/ChannelIslands.aspx].) Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166-1 represent Jersey as a top-level entry. Also note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for Jersey as an administrative subdivision of the entry named "UNITED KINGDOM".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: JOHNSTON ATOLL
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Johnston Atoll. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Johnston Atoll.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Johnston Atoll as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: JUAN DE NOVA ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Juan de Nova Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the GENC entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of Juan de Nova Island (one of the French scattered Indian Ocean islands). Note that ISO 3166-1 considers Juan de Nova Island to be included in the entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN TERRITORIES".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: KINGMAN REEF
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Kingman Reef. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Kingman Reef.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Kingman Reef as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: KIRIBATI
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises Kiribati (Principal atoll: Tarawa, including Banaba), part of Line Islands (including Kiritimati), Phoenix Islands (including Kanton and Enderbury Island)
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Kiribati" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Kiribati". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Comprises Kiribati (Principal atoll: Tarawa, including Banaba), part of Line Islands (including Kiritimati), Phoenix Islands (including Kanton and Enderbury Island)", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comprises Gilbert Islands (Principal atoll: Tarawa, including Banaba), part of Line Islands (including Kiritimati), Phoenix Islands (including Abariringa, Enderbury Island)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: KOREA, NORTH
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "KOREA, NORTH" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "KOREA, DEMOCRATIC PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Korea, North" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Korea (the Democratic People's Republic of)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Democratic People’s Republic of Korea" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ko'/'kor' as "Chosŏn-minjujuŭi-inmin-konghwaguk" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Chosŏn".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: KOREA, SOUTH
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "KOREA, SOUTH" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "KOREA, REPUBLIC OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Korea, South" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Korea (the Republic of)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Republic of Korea" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Korea". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ko'/'kor' as "Taehan-min’guk" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Han'guk".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: KOSOVO
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Kosovo.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-1 considers the entry named "SERBIA" as including the geographic territory of Kosovo as an ISO 3166-2 administrative subdivision of type "autonomous province".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: LAOS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "LAOS" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "LAO PEOPLE'S DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC"; GENC specifies the short name "Laos" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Lao People's Democratic Republic (the)"; GENC specifies the full name "Lao People’s Democratic Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Lao People’s Democratic Republic".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MACAU
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "MACAU" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "MACAO" (different spelling); GENC specifies the short name "Macau" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Macao"; and GENC specifies the full name "Macau Special Administrative Region" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Macao Special Administrative Region of China".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geospatial extent of Macau to be distinct from that covered by the entry named "CHINA"; it is represented exclusively by the GENC entry named "MACAU". Note that ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "CHINA" as including the geographic territory of Macao; ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "MACAO", but also ISO 3166-2 specifies a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "special administrative region") named "Aomen" (local name).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MACEDONIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "MACEDONIA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "MACEDONIA, THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Macedonia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Macedonia (the former Yugoslav Republic of)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Republic of Macedonia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'mk'/'mkd' as "Makedonija" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Poranešna Jugoslovenska Republika Makedonija".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MALAYSIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises Peninsular Malaysia, Sabah, and Sarawak.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard entry named "MALAYSIA" specifically excludes the geospatial extent of the Spratly Islands, which is represented by a distinct GENC entry named "SPRATLY ISLANDS". The Spratly Islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam, and in part by Brunei, Malaysia, and Philippines. The ISO 3166/MA may consider some or all of the territory of the Spratly Islands to be included under the ISO 3166-1 entry named "MALAYSIA".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MARSHALL ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Principal atolls: Jaluit, Kwajalein, and Majuro.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Marshall Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Marshall Islands (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Republic of the Marshall Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of the Marshall Islands". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Marshall Islands", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Marshall Islands (the)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MARTINIQUE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Department of Martinique" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Martinique". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Martinique", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Martinique (la)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Martinique from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes the geographic territory of Martinique, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas department") named "Martinique".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MAURITIUS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Agalega Islands, Cargados Carajos Shoals, Île Rodrigues
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Mauritius" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Mauritius". In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Agalega Islands, Cargados Carajos Shoals, Île Rodrigues", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Agalega Islands, Cargados Carajos Shoals, Rodrigues Island".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MAYOTTE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Department of Mayotte" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Mayotte".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Mayotte from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes the geographic territory of Mayotte, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas department") named "Mayotte".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MICRONESIA, FEDERATED STATES OF
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Caroline Islands (except PALAU, see separate entry). Principal islands: Chuuk, Kosrae, Pohnpei, Yap
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Micronesia, Federated States of" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Micronesia (the Federated States of)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Federated States of Micronesia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Federated States of Micronesia". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Federated States of Micronesia", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Federated States of Micronesia (the)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MIDWAY ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Midway Islands. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Midway Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Midway Islands as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MOLDOVA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "MOLDOVA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "MOLDOVA, REPUBLIC OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Moldova" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Moldova (the Republic of)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Republic of Moldova" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Moldova". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'mo'/'mol' as "Moldova" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Republica Moldova".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: MONGOLIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'mn'/'mon' as "Mongol Uls" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Mongol".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NAVASSA ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Navassa Island. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Navassa Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Navassa Island as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NETHERLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Netherlands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Netherlands (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Kingdom of the Netherlands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Kingdom of the Netherlands".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the entry named "NETHERLANDS" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of Aruba, Curaçao, Sint Maarten, and the group of special municipalities consisting of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba, because the GENC Standard contains a distinct entry for each of those four areas. Note that ISO 3166-1 also includes entries for each of “ARUBA”, “CURAÇAO”, “SINT MAARTEN (DUTCH PART)”, and “BONAIRE, SINT EUSTATIUS AND SABA”, but ISO 3166-2 also specifies code elements for corresponding administrative subdivisions for each of them (of type "country" for the first three, and of type “special municipality” for the three constituents of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba). See ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision). Note: There may be ambiguity in the standards between the country of the Netherlands and the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NEW CALEDONIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Îles Loyauté
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Îles Loyauté", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes the Loyalty Islands." The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Nouvelle-Calédonie", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Nouvelle-Calédonie (la)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of New Caledonia from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes New Caledonia, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas territorial collectivity") named "Nouvelle-Calédonie".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NEW ZEALAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes the Antipodes Island Group, Auckland Islands, Campbell Island, Chatham Islands, and Kermadec Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes the Antipodes Island Group, Auckland Islands, Campbell Island, Chatham Islands, and Kermadec Islands.", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes the Antipodes Islands, Auckland Islands, Campbell Island, Chatham Islands, and Kermadec Islands."

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NO MAN'S LAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: No man’s land is a form of neutral zone with no sovereignty or military jurisdiction.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes this 3-character ISO user-assigned code element for No Man's Land. Note that 'XX' is 3166/MA user-assigned alpha-2 code element for a "temporary reservation for a new UN member state".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NORFOLK ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Territory of Norfolk Island" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Norfolk Island".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises Mariana Islands (except GUAM, see separate entry). (Principal island: Saipan)
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Northern Mariana Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Northern Mariana Islands (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands)". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Northern Mariana Islands", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Northern Mariana Islands (the)".
