genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geographic territory of the Northern Mariana Islands to be specifically excluded from the geographic territory of the entry named "UNITED STATES". Note that the ISO 3166/MA considers the United States as including the geographic territory of the Northern Mariana Islands; while ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS", ISO 3166-2 specifies a code element for the Northern Mariana Islands as a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: NORWAY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Kingdom of Norway" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Kingdom of Norway".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Both the GENC Standard and ISO 3166/MA consider the geospatial extent of Norfolk Island as external to the territory of Australia. The GENC Standard contains separate top-level entries for the external territories of Australia (including the Ashmore and Cartier Islands, Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, the Coral Sea Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island); as a general principle, top-level GENC entries do not overlap in territory. The Australian external territories that have entries in ISO 3166-1 (Christmas Island, the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, Heard Island and McDonald Islands, and Norfolk Island) do not have corresponding entries as administrative subdivisions in ISO 3166-2, thus are not included in the geospatial extent of Australia (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: OMAN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes part of Shibh Jazīrat Musandam (Musandam Peninsula)
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Sultanate of Oman" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Sultanate of Oman". In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes part of Shibh Jazīrat Musandam (Musandam Peninsula)", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes part of the Musandam Peninsula".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: PALESTINIAN TERRITORY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "PALESTINIAN TERRITORY" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "PALESTINIAN TERRITORY, OCCUPIED"; GENC specifies the short name "Palestinian Territory" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Palestinian Territory (the Occupied)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Palestinian Territory" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Occupied Palestinian Territory". The GENC Standard excludes the local short name for 'ar'/'ara' where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Al arḍ al filasṭīniya al-muḥtalla".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The Palestinian Territory is composed of the geospatial extent of the Gaza Strip and the West Bank, which also have separate entries in the GENC Standard; the GENC allows this overlap in entries in order to meet a community information requirement.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: PALMYRA ATOLL
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Palmyra Atoll. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Palmyra Atoll.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Palmyra Atoll as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: PAPUA NEW GUINEA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Independent State of Papua New Guinea
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes the Bismarck Archipelago and the Northern Solomon Islands (principal island: Bougainville).
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Independent State of Papua New Guinea" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Papua New Guinea".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: PARACEL ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the Paracel Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard entry named "PARACEL ISLANDS" uses user-assigned code elements to represent these disputed islands in the South China Sea, while ISO 3166-1 does not include a specific entry for them. The Paracel Islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: PHILIPPINES
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Philippines" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Philippines (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Republic of the Philippines" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of the Philippines". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Philippines", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Philippines (the)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard entry named "PHILIPPINES" specifically excludes the geospatial extent of the Spratly Islands, which is represented by a distinct GENC entry named "SPRATLY ISLANDS". The Spratly Islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam, and in part by Brunei, Malaysia, and Philippines. The ISO 3166/MA may consider some or all of the territory of the Spratly Islands to be included under the ISO 3166-1 entry named "PHILIPPINES".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: PITCAIRN ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Pitcairn, Henderson, Ducie, and Oeno Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Henderson Island, Ducie Atoll, and Oeno Atoll
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "PITCAIRN ISLANDS" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "PITCAIRN"; GENC specifies the short name "Pitcairn Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Pitcairn"; and GENC specifies the full name "Pitcairn, Henderson, Ducie, and Oeno Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Pitcairn". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Henderson Island, Ducie Atoll, and Oeno Atoll.", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Ducie Island, Henderson Island, and Oeno Island." The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Pitcairn Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Pitcairn".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Pitcairn Islands is a British Overseas Territory. British Overseas Territories are distinct areas that are not part of the territory of the United Kingdom. There are 14 such territories, including: Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territory; British Virgin Islands; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Islands; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia); and the Turks and Caicos Islands. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) ISO 3166-1 contains entries for twelve of the fourteen British Overseas Territories. The two British Overseas Territories omitted from ISO 3166-1 are the British Antarctic Territory (ISO includes no national Antarctic claims) and the Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia, as a single British Overseas Territory). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for any of those territories as an administrative subdivision of the United Kingdom. GENC also contains specific top-level entries for the same twelve British Overseas Territories found in ISO 3166-1, and in addition, GENC contains separate entries for each of Akrotiri, Dhekelia, and Diego Garcia.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: PUERTO RICO
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Commonwealth of the Puerto Rico" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Puerto Rico".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geographic territory of Puerto Rico to be specifically excluded from the geographic territory of the entry named "UNITED STATES". Note that the ISO 3166/MA considers the United States as including the geographic territory of Puerto Rico; while ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "PUERTO RICO", ISO 3166-2 specifies a code element for Puerto Rico as a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: REUNION
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "REUNION" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "RÉUNION" (different spelling); GENC specifies the short name "Reunion" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Réunion"; and GENC specifies the full name "Department of Reunion" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Réunion". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Réunion" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "La Réunion".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Reunion from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes La Réunion, and ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas department") named "La Réunion". In the GENC Standard, the territory of Reunion is represented exclusively by the entry named "REUNION".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: RUSSIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Kaliningrad region
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "RUSSIA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "RUSSIAN FEDERATION"; GENC specifies the short name "Russia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Russian Federation (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Russian Federation" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Russian Federation". Additionally, in order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Kaliningrad region", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes the Kaliningrad Region." The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ru'/'rus' as "Rossiya" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Rossijskaja Federacija".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geopolitical entity named "RUSSIA" as excluding the geospatial extent of the Etorofu, Habomai, Kunashiri, and Shikotan Islands, which collectively have a separate GENC entry named "ETOROFU, HABOMAI, KUNASHIRI, AND SHIKOTAN ISLANDS". Note that ISO 3166-1 may consider the entry named "RUSSIAN FEDERATION" as including the geographic territory of the Etorofu, Habomai, Kunashiri, and Shikotan Islands (southernmost members of the Kuril Islands) as a component of the ISO 3166-2 Sakhalin Oblast administrative subdivision (which is of type "administrative region").

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SAINT BARTHELEMY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "SAINT BARTHELEMY" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "SAINT BARTHÉLEMY" (different spelling); GENC specifies the short name "Saint Barthelemy" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Barthélemy"; and GENC specifies the full name "Saint Barthelemy" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Barthélemy".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Saint Barthelemy from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes Saint Barthelemy, and ISO 3166-2 includes code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas territorial collectivity") named "Saint Barthélemy". In the GENC Standard, the territory of Saint Barthelemy is represented exclusively by the entry named "SAINT BARTHELEMY".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SAINT HELENA, ASCENSION, AND TRISTAN DA CUNHA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:shortName: Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises: Saint Helena Island, Ascension Island, Tristan da Cunha Group (Gough Island, Inaccessible Island, Nightingale Island and Stoltenhoff Island).
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard differs ISO 3166-1 in the punctuation of the name; GENC uses a comma before the "and" in all forms of the name, whereas ISO 3166-1 does not. In particular, the GENC Standard specifies the name "SAINT HELENA, ASCENSION, AND TRISTAN DA CUNHA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "SAINT HELENA, ASCENSION AND TRISTAN DA CUNHA"; GENC specifies the short name "Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha"; and GENC specifies the full name "Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha". Additionally, the GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha". In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Comprises: Saint Helena Island, Ascension Island, Tristan da Cunha Group (Gough Island, Inaccessible Island, Nightingale Island and Stoltenhoff Island).", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comprises: Saint Helena Island, Ascension Island, Tristan da Cunha Archipelago (Gough Island, Inaccessible Island, Nightingale Island and Stoltenhoff Island)."
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha (together) is a British Overseas Territory. British Overseas Territories are distinct areas that are not part of the territory of the United Kingdom. There are 14 such territories, including: Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territory; British Virgin Islands; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Islands; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia); and the Turks and Caicos Islands. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) ISO 3166-1 contains entries for twelve of the fourteen British Overseas Territories. The two British Overseas Territories omitted from ISO 3166-1 are the British Antarctic Territory (ISO includes no national Antarctic claims) and the Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia, as a single British Overseas Territory). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for any of those territories as an administrative subdivision of the United Kingdom. GENC also contains specific top-level entries for the same twelve British Overseas Territories found in ISO 3166-1, and in addition, GENC contains separate entries for each of Akrotiri, Dhekelia, and Diego Garcia.

genc:localShortName.genc:name: Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SAINT MARTIN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: The island of Saint Martin is divided into the French northern part and the Dutch southern part.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "SAINT MARTIN" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "SAINT MARTIN (FRENCH PART)"; GENC specifies the short name "Saint Martin" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Martin (French part)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Saint Martin" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Martin (French part)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Saint Martin from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry "FRANCE" includes Saint Martin, and ISO 3166-2 includes code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas territorial collectivity"). In the GENC Standard, the territory of Saint Martin is represented exclusively by the entry named "SAINT MARTIN".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SAINT PIERRE AND MIQUELON
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: Territorial Collectivity of Saint Pierre and Miquelon
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Territorial Collectivity of Saint Pierre and Miquelon" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint Pierre and Miquelon". The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Saint Pierre and Miquelon from the entry named "FRANCE". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Saint-Pierre et Miquelon" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes Saint Pierre and Miquelon, and ISO 3166-2 includes code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas territorial collectivity"). In the GENC Standard, the territory of Saint Pierre and Miquelon is represented exclusively by the entry named "SAINT PIERRE AND MIQUELON".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SAINT VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises the northern Grenadines (Principal island: Bequia), Saint Vincent Island
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Comprises the northern Grenadines (Principal island: Bequia), Saint Vincent Island", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comprises Northern Grenadine Islands (Principal island: Bequia), Saint Vincent Island".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SAUDI ARABIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Kingdom of Saudi Arabia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ar'/'ara' as "Al ‘Arabīyah as Su‘ūdīyah" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "As Sa‘ūdīyah".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SERBIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Serbia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Serbia".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geopolitical entity named "SERBIA" as specifically excluding the geographic territory of Kosovo, which has a distinct entry (named "KOSOVO") in the GENC Standard. Note that the ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "SERBIA" as including the geographic territory of Kosovo, because ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "autonomous province") named "Kosovo-Metohija".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SEYCHELLES
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Principal island: Mahé; Includes Groupe d'Aldabra, Les Amirantes, Atoll de Cosmoledo, Atoll de Faruhar
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Seychelles" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Seychelles". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Principal island: Mahé; Includes Groupe d'Aldabra, Les Amirantes, Atoll de Cosmoledo, Atoll de Faruhar", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Principal island: Mahé; Includes Aldabra Islands, Amirante Islands, Cosmoledo Islands, Farquhar Islands". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Seychelles", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Seychelles (les)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SINT MAARTEN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: The island of Saint Martin is divided into the French northern part and the Dutch southern part.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "SINT MAARTEN" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "SINT MAARTEN (DUTCH PART)"; GENC specifies the short name "Sint Maarten" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Sint Maarten (Dutch part)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Sint Maarten" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Sint Maarten (Dutch part)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Sint Maarten from the entry named "NETHERLANDS". Note that, although ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "SINT MAARTEN (DUTCH PART)", ISO 3166-2 correspondingly specifies a code element for Sint Maarten as an administrative subdivision (of type "country") of the entry named "NETHERLANDS" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)). In the GENC Standard, the territory of Sint Maarten is represented exclusively by the entry named "SINT MAARTEN". Note: There may be ambiguity in the standards between the country of the Netherlands and the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SOMALIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Somalia" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Somali Republic".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SOUTH AFRICA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Marion Island, Prince Edward Island
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'zu'/'zul' as "iNingizimu Afrika" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Ningizimu Afrika"; it specifies the local short name for 'tn'/'tsn' as "Aforika Borwa" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Afrika-Borwa"; it specifies the local short name for 'ts'/'tso' as "Afrika Dzonga" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Afrika- Dzonga"; it specifies the local short name for 've'/'ven' as "Afurika Tshipembe" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Afrika Tshipembe"; it specifies the local short name for 'xh'/'xho' as "umZantsi Afrika" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Mzantsi Afrika"; and, it specifies the local short name for 'zu'/'zul' as "iNingizimu Afrika" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Ningizimu Afrika".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SOUTH GEORGIA AND SOUTH SANDWICH ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:shortName: South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:fullName: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "SOUTH GEORGIA AND SOUTH SANDWICH ISLANDS" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "SOUTH GEORGIA AND THE SOUTH SANDWICH ISLANDS" (different spelling); and GENC specifies the short name "South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands is a British Overseas Territory. British Overseas Territories are distinct areas that are not part of the territory of the United Kingdom. There are 14 such territories, including: Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territory; British Virgin Islands; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Islands; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia); and the Turks and Caicos Islands. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) ISO 3166-1 contains entries for twelve of the fourteen British Overseas Territories. The two British Overseas Territories omitted from ISO 3166-1 are the British Antarctic Territory (ISO includes no national Antarctic claims) and the Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia, as a single British Overseas Territory). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for any of those territories as an administrative subdivision of the United Kingdom. GENC also contains specific top-level entries for the same twelve British Overseas Territories found in ISO 3166-1, and in addition, GENC contains separate entries for each of Akrotiri, Dhekelia, and Diego Garcia.

genc:localShortName.genc:name: South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SPRATLY ISLANDS
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the Spratly Islands.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard entry named "SPRATLY ISLANDS" uses user-assigned code elements to represent these disputed islands in the South China Sea, while ISO 3166-1 does not include a specific entry for them. These islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam, and in part by Brunei, Malaysia, and Philippines.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SVALBARD
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Bjørnøya
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Svalbard (distinct from those for Jan Mayen). ISO 3166-1 includes a single composite entry named "SVALBARD AND JAN MAYEN".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: ISO 3166-1 covers this area under the entry named "SVALBARD AND JAN MAYEN". Note also that ISO 3166-2 considers the ISO 3166-1 entry named "NORWAY" as including the geographic territory of Svalbard as an administrative subdivision (of type "arctic region").

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: SYRIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "SYRIA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "SYRIAN ARAB REPUBLIC"; GENC specifies the short name "Syria" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Syrian Arab Republic (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Syrian Arab Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Syrian Arab Republic". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ar'/'ara' as "Sūrīyah" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Al Jumhūrīyah al Άrabīyah as Sūrīyah".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: TAIWAN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes the Pescadores (Penghu Qundao)
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "TAIWAN" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "TAIWAN, PROVINCE OF CHINA"; GENC specifies the short name "Taiwan" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Taiwan (Province of China)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Taiwan" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Taiwan (Province of China)". Additionally, in order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes the Pescadores (Penghu Qundao)", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes the Penghu (Pescadores) Islands."
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard does not include Taiwan as a province under the entry named "CHINA". The GENC Standard considers the geospatial extent of Taiwan to be distinct from that covered by the entry named "CHINA", and to be represented exclusively by the GENC entry named "TAIWAN". Note that ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "CHINA" as including the geographic territory of Taiwan; ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "TAIWAN, PROVINCE OF CHINA", but also ISO 3166-2 specifies a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "province") named "Taiwan". Additionally, the GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of the Paracel Islands and of the Spratly Islands from the GENC entry named "TAIWAN". The Paracel Islands in the South China Sea are claimed by China (including Taiwan) and by Vietnam. The Spratly Islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam, and in part by Brunei, Malaysia, and Philippines.The GENC Standard represents both with distinct entries ("PARACEL ISLANDS" and "SPRATLY ISLANDS"). The ISO 3166/MA may consider some territory of the Paracel Islands or Spratly Islands to be included under the ISO 3166-1 entry named "TAIWAN, PROVINCE OF CHINA".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: TANZANIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "TANZANIA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "TANZANIA, UNITED REPUBLIC OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Tanzania" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Tanzania, United Republic of"; and GENC specifies the full name "United Republic of Tanzania" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the United Republic of Tanzania". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'en' as "Tanzania" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "United Republic of Tanzania". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'sw'/'swa' as "Tanzania" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Jamhuri ya Muungano wa Tanzania".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: TROMELIN ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Tromelin Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the GENC entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN AND ANTARCTIC LANDS" as specifically excluding the geospatial extent of Tromelin Island (one of the French scattered Indian Ocean islands). Note that ISO 3166-1 considers Tromelin Island to be included in the entry named "FRENCH SOUTHERN TERRITORIES".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: TUNISIA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Tunisian Republic" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Tunisia". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ar'/'ara' as "Tūnis" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Tūnus".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: UKRAINE
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'uk'/'ukr' as "Ukrayina" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Ukraina".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: UNITED ARAB EMIRATES
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "United Arab Emirates" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "United Arab Emirates (the)"; and GENC specifies the full name "United Arab Emirates" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the United Arab Emirates". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'ar'/'ara' as "Al Imārāt al ‘Arabīyah al Muttaḩidah" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Al Imārāt".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: UNITED STATES
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "United States of America" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the United States of America". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "United States", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "United States (the)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the entry named "UNITED STATES" as specifically excluding the geographic territory of American Samoa, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Each of those territories has a distinct entry in the GENC Standard. Note that the ISO 3166/MA considers the entry named "UNITED STATES" as including all of those territories, because ISO 3166-2 specifies code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision in each case. (See ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision).) The GENC Standard also considers the entry named "UNITED STATES" as specifically excluding the geographic territory of Baker Island, Howland Island, Jarvis Island, Johnson Atoll, Kingman Reef, the Midway Islands, Navassa Island, Palmyra Atoll, and Wake Island; each of those territories has a distinct entry in the GENC Standard. Note that ISO 3166-2 includes each of those geographic territories as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") under the entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS", which in turn is also represented in ISO 3166-2 as a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: UNKNOWN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: A geopolitical entity that is not identified.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: URUGUAY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Oriental Republic of Uruguay" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Eastern Republic of Uruguay". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'es'/'esp' as "Uruguay", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Uruguay (el)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: VANUATU
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Principal islands: Éfaté, Espirito Santo
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Vanuatu" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Vanuatu". In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Principal islands: Éfaté, Espirito Santo", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Principal islands: Efate, Santo". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Vanuatu", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Vanuatu (le)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: VATICAN CITY
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "VATICAN CITY" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "HOLY SEE (VATICAN CITY STATE)"; GENC specifies the short name "Vatican City" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Holy See (the) [Vatican City State]"; and GENC specifies the full name "State of the Vatican City" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Holy See (the) [Vatican City State]". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'it'/'ita' as "Città del Vaticano" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Santa Sede (la)".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: VENEZUELA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Isla de Aves
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "VENEZUELA" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "VENEZUELA, BOLIVARIAN REPUBLIC OF"; GENC specifies the short name "Venezuela" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela"; and GENC specifies the full name "Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela". Additionally, in order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Isla de Aves", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Bird Island."

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: VIETNAM
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the name "VIETNAM" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "VIET NAM" (different spelling); GENC specifies the short name "Vietnam" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Viet Nam"; and GENC specifies the full name "Socialist Republic of Vietnam" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Socialist Republic of Vietnam".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of the Paracel Islands and of the Spratly Islands from the GENC entry named "VIETNAM". The Paracel Islands in the South China Sea are claimed by China (including Taiwan) and by Vietnam. The Spratly Islands in the South China Sea are claimed in their entirety by China (including Taiwan) and Vietnam, and in part by Brunei, Malaysia, and Philippines.The GENC Standard represents both with distinct entries ("PARACEL ISLANDS" and "SPRATLY ISLANDS"). The ISO 3166/MA may consider some territory of the Paracel Islands or Spratly Islands to be included under the ISO 3166-1 entry named "VIET NAM".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: VIRGIN ISLANDS, BRITISH
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Principal islands: Anegada, Jost Van Dyke, Tortola, and Virgin Gorda.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Virgin Islands, British" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Virgin Islands (British)"; and GENC specifies the full name "Virgin Islands, British" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "British Virgin Islands (the)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The British Virgin Islands is a British Overseas Territory. British Overseas Territories are distinct areas that are not part of the territory of the United Kingdom. There are 14 such territories, including: Anguilla; Bermuda; British Antarctic Territory; British Indian Ocean Territory; British Virgin Islands; Cayman Islands; Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas); Gibraltar; Montserrat; Pitcairn Islands; Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha; South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands; Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia); and the Turks and Caicos Islands. (See [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/overseas-territories].) ISO 3166-1 contains entries for twelve of the fourteen British Overseas Territories. The two British Overseas Territories omitted from ISO 3166-1 are the British Antarctic Territory (ISO includes no national Antarctic claims) and the Sovereign Base Area on Cyprus (Akrotiri and Dhekelia, as a single British Overseas Territory). Note that ISO 3166-2 does not contain code elements for any of those territories as an administrative subdivision of the United Kingdom. GENC also contains specific top-level entries for the same twelve British Overseas Territories found in ISO 3166-1, and in addition, GENC contains separate entries for each of Akrotiri, Dhekelia, and Diego Garcia.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: VIRGIN ISLANDS, U.S.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Principal islands: Saint Croix, Saint John, and Saint Thomas.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the short name "Virgin Islands, U.S." where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Virgin Islands (U.S.)"; and GENC specifies the full name "United States Virgin Islands" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Virgin Islands of the United States". The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'en'/'eng' as "Virgin Islands of the United States", removing the definite article, where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Virgin Islands of the United States (the)".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard considers the geographic territory of the U.S. Virgin Islands to be specifically excluded from the geographic territory of the entry named "UNITED STATES". Note that the ISO 3166/MA considers the United States as including the geographic territory of the U.S. Virgin Islands; while ISO 3166-1 includes an entry named "VIRGIN ISLANDS, U.S.", ISO 3166-2 specifies a code element for "Virgin Islands, U.S." as a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES" (see ISO 3166-1:2006, Clause 4.3 "Overlaps"; and ISO 3166-2:2007, Clause 4.1.2 (on subdivision)).

genc:localShortName.genc:name: Virgin Islands of the United States

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: WAKE ISLAND
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for Wake Island. ISO 3166-1 does not contain a separate entry for Wake Island.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: Note that ISO 3166-2 includes Wake Island as an administrative subdivision (of type "islands, groups of islands") of the ISO 3166-1 entry named "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS". ISO 3166-2 includes a corresponding entry named "United States Minor Outlying Islands", which is an administrative subdivision (of type "outlying area") of the entry named "UNITED STATES". The ISO 3166-1 entry "UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS" comprises nine U.S. islands and island groups that are represented by separate entries at the top level of the GENC Standard.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: WALLIS AND FUTUNA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Comprises the Îles de Horne (principal island: Futuna) and Wallis Islands (principal island: Île Uvea).
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: In order to correct multiple naming anomalies the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Comprises the Îles de Horne (principal island: Futuna) and Wallis Islands (principal island: Île Uvea).", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Comprises the Hoorn Islands (principal island: Futuna) and Wallis Islands (principal island: Uvea)." The GENC Standard specifies the local short name for 'fr'/'fra' as "Wallis et Futuna" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "Wallis-et-Futuna".
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The GENC Standard specifically excludes the geospatial extent of Wallis and Futuna from the entry named "FRANCE". Note that ISO 3166-1 states that the entry named "FRANCE" includes the geographic territory of Wallis and Futuna, and ISO 3166-2 includes code elements for a corresponding administrative subdivision (of type "overseas territorial collectivity") named “Wallis-et-Futuna” (local name).

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: WEST BANK
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard includes these ISO user-assigned code elements for the West Bank.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnTerritory: The West Bank is currently Israeli-occupied with its current status subject to the Israeli-Palstinian Interim Agreement; its permanent status is to be determined through further negotiation. The West Bank is a geospatial component of the GENC geopolitical entity named "PALESTINIAN TERRITORY".

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: WESTERN SAHARA
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Sovereignity yet to be determined.
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard does not consider the name to be provisional but specifies that the sovereignity is yet to be determined.

genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:name: YEMEN
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:remarks: Includes Socotra
genc:GeopoliticalEntityEntry.genc:entryNotesOnNaming: The GENC Standard specifies the full name "Republic of Yemen" where instead ISO 3166-1 specifies "the Republic of Yemen". In order to correct a naming anomaly the GENC Standard specifies the remarks "Includes Socotra", while ISO 3166-1 specifies "Includes Socotra Island".
